derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: from French stratégique, from Greek stratēgikos, from stratēgos (see stratagem)

entry.def: Strategic means relating to the most important, general aspects of something such as a military operation or political policy, especially when these are decided in advance.

example.ex: ...the new strategic thinking which NATO leaders produced at the recent London summit...
example.tran: 北约领导人在最近召开的伦敦首脑会议上提出的新的战略思想

example.ex: ...a strategic plan for reducing the rate of infant mortality...
example.tran: 降低婴儿死亡率的战略计划

entry.def: Strategic weapons are very powerful missiles that can be fired only after a decision to use them has been made by a political leader.

entry.tran: (位置)具有战略意义的，重要的，合适的
entry.def: If you put something in a strategic position, you place it cleverly in a position where it will be most useful or have the most effect.

example.ex: ...the marble benches Eve had placed at strategic points throughout the gardens, where the views were spectacular.
example.tran: 伊芙在各花园景色迷人的地方巧妙安置的大理石长凳

means.word_mean: 1. relating to or concerned with strategy;
2. highly important to or an integral part of a strategy or plan of action especially in war;
